item.title: How to reshape a dataframe from wide to long or long to wide format
item.description: Reshaping a dataframe / table from long to wide format or wide to long format is one of the daily tasks a Data Analyst / Data Scientist would be doing. The long format is similar to the tidy format that the tidyverse advocates. Even while, it’s been a very common task - the tidyr package’s solution of using spread() and gather() almost never was intuitive enough to be used in the code without SOing or Referring the documentation.

item.title: Find out Bulk Email ID Reputations Risk using R
item.description: If you are working in Info Sec / Cyber Security, One of the things that might be part of your day job is to filter email to remove spams / phishing emails. While this could be done at several levels and ways, monitoring the email id (like abc@xyz.com) and validating its reputation to see if it seems risky / suspicious or authentic and then allowing them to reach the user inbox - is one of the solid ways (while it’s also error-prone with False Positives).

item.title: How to embed Excel-like Spreadsheet Table in RMarkdown
item.description: If there’s a component that’s least interactive in an RMarkdown rendered document or a Shiny app - that’d be the Table that’s displayed. Yes, datatable does a good job of improving the Table Apperance and custom formatting like Conditional Formatting, it doesn’t give a Google Spreadsheet or Microsoft Excel flavor. This post is to let you know how you can embed that excel-like spreadsheet Table in your Rmarkdown.

item.title: How to do negation-proof sentiment analysis in R
item.description: Sentiment Analysis is one of those things in Machine learning which is still getting improvement with the rise of Deep Learning based NLP solutions. There are many things like Sarcasm, Negations and similar items make Sentiment Analysis a rather tough nut to crack. Deep learning as much as it’s effective, it’s also computationally expensive and if you are ready to trade off between Cost (expense) and Accuracy, then you this is the solution for building a negation-proof Sentiment Analysis solution (in R).
